thread.title: Three days of road closures kick off in Abu Dhabi
thread.title_full: Three days of road closures kick off in Abu Dhabi | GulfNews.com

author: Cleofe Maceda, Senior Web Reporter
title: Three days of road closures kick off in Abu Dhabi

persons.name: shaikh khalifa bin zayed al nahyan highway

text:
A series of road closures that last for three days in Abu Dhabi started on Thursday, as bikers hit the streets for the 2017 Abu Dhabi Tour.
The first batch of roadblocks has been deployed today in the Western Region, spanning 189 kilometres, with a couple more partial closures scheduled this weekend.
On Friday, access will be limited in various city streets spanning a total of 153 kilometres, with the first phase taking place from 12.30pm.
Closures will start from Reem Island, as bikers make a loop from there and pass through Abu Dhabi Island, Al Khaleej Al Arabi St., Shakhbout City, Al Falah, Yas Island, Shaikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan Highway and Saadiyat Island.
The next day, Saturday, partial road closures covering 186 kilometres will affect drivers taking Al Ain city roads starting from 11.35am.  Partial Closure of Western Region Roads - Length 189 KM on Thursday 23th February, 2017 #RideToAbuDhabi pic.twitter.com/1lHp7WYNu9 — STSC Abu Dhabi (@stscabudhabi) February 21, 2017 Partial Closure of Ain City Roads - Length 186 KM on Saturday, February 25, 2017 #RideToAbuDhabi pic.twitter.com/VNqUoDpC1S — STSC Abu Dhabi (@stscabudhabi) February 23, 2017 Partial Closure of Abu Dhabi Roads - Length 153 KM on Friday, February 24, 2017 #RideToAbuDhabi pic.twitter.com/dDrkQcMZJG 
— STSC Abu Dhabi (@stscabudhabi) February 22, 2017   Partial Closure of Ain City Roads - Length 186 KM on Saturday, February 25, 2017 #RideToAbuDhabi pic.twitter.com/VNqUoDpC1S — STSC Abu Dhabi (@stscabudhabi) February 23, 2017
